body.p: IAS 36 relies on an ‘economic’ criterion for the recognition of an impairment loss—an impairment loss is recognised whenever the recoverable amount of an asset is below its carrying amount. This criterion was already used in many International Accounting Standards before IAS 36, such as IAS 9 Research and Development Costs, IAS 22 Business Combinations, and IAS 16 Property, Plant and Equipment.
